text: We have been up and down to seek thee, for

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: we are high-proof melancholy and would fain have

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: it beaten away. Wilt thou use thy wit?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: It is in my scabbard. Shall I draw it?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Dost thou wear thy wit by thy side?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Never any did so, though very many have

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: been beside their wit. I will bid thee draw, as we do

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: the minstrels: draw to pleasure us.

speaker: PRINCE
text: As I am an honest man, he looks pale.—Art

speaker: PRINCE
text: thou sick, or angry?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: What, courage, man! What

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: though care killed a cat? Thou hast mettle enough

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: in thee to kill care.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Sir, I shall meet your wit in the career, an

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you charge it against me. I pray you, choose another

speaker: BENEDICK
text: subject.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Nay, then, give him another staff.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: This last was broke ’cross.

speaker: PRINCE
text: By this light, he changes more and more. I

speaker: PRINCE
text: think he be angry indeed.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If he be, he knows how to turn his girdle.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Shall I speak a word in your ear?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: God bless me from a challenge!

speaker: BENEDICK
text: You are a villain. I jest

speaker: BENEDICK
text: not. I will make it good how you dare, with what you

speaker: BENEDICK
text: dare, and when you dare. Do me right, or I will

speaker: BENEDICK
text: protest your cowardice. You have killed a sweet

speaker: BENEDICK
text: lady, and her death shall fall heavy on you. Let me

speaker: BENEDICK
text: hear from you.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Well, I will meet you, so I may have good

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: cheer.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, a feast, a feast?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I’ faith, I thank him. He hath bid me to a

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: calf’s head and a capon, the which if I do not carve

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: most curiously, say my knife’s naught. Shall I not

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: find a woodcock too?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Sir, your wit ambles well; it goes easily.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I’ll tell thee how Beatrice praised thy wit the

speaker: PRINCE
text: other day. I said thou hadst a fine wit. “True,” said

speaker: PRINCE
text: she, “a fine little one.” “No,” said I, “a great wit.”

speaker: PRINCE
text: “Right,” says she, “a great gross one.” “Nay,” said I,

speaker: PRINCE
text: “a good wit.” “Just,” said she, “it hurts nobody.”

speaker: PRINCE
text: “Nay,” said I, “the gentleman is wise.” “Certain,”

speaker: PRINCE
text: said she, “a wise gentleman.” “Nay,” said I, “he

speaker: PRINCE
text: hath the tongues.” “That I believe,” said she, “for he

speaker: PRINCE
text: swore a thing to me on Monday night which he

speaker: PRINCE
text: forswore on Tuesday morning; there’s a double

speaker: PRINCE
text: tongue, there’s two tongues.” Thus did she an hour

speaker: PRINCE
text: together transshape thy particular virtues. Yet at

speaker: PRINCE
text: last she concluded with a sigh, thou wast the

speaker: PRINCE
text: proper’st man in Italy.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: For the which she wept heartily and said she

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: cared not.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, that she did. But yet for all that, an if she

speaker: PRINCE
text: did not hate him deadly, she would love him

speaker: PRINCE
text: dearly. The old man’s daughter told us all.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: All, all. And, moreover, God saw him when

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: he was hid in the garden.

speaker: PRINCE
text: But when shall we set the savage bull’s horns

speaker: PRINCE
text: on the sensible Benedick’s head?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Yea, and text underneath: “Here dwells Benedick,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: the married man”?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Fare you well, boy. You know my mind. I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: will leave you now to your gossip-like humor. You

speaker: BENEDICK
text: break jests as braggarts do their blades, which, God

speaker: BENEDICK
text: be thanked, hurt not.—My lord, for your many

speaker: BENEDICK
text: courtesies I thank you. I must discontinue your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: company. Your brother the Bastard is fled from

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Messina. You have among you killed a sweet and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: innocent lady. For my Lord Lackbeard there, he and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I shall meet, and till then peace be with him.

speaker: PRINCE
text: He is in earnest.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: In most profound earnest, and, I’ll warrant

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: you, for the love of Beatrice.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And hath challenged thee?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Most sincerely.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What a pretty thing man is when he goes in his

speaker: PRINCE
text: doublet and hose and leaves off his wit!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: He is then a giant to an ape; but then is an ape

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: a doctor to such a man.

speaker: PRINCE
text: But soft you, let me be. Pluck up, my heart,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and be sad. Did he not say my brother was fled?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Come you, sir. If justice cannot tame you,

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: she shall ne’er weigh more reasons in her balance.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Nay, an you be a cursing hypocrite once, you must

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: be looked to.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How now, two of my brother’s men bound?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Borachio one!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Hearken after their offense, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Officers, what offense have these men done?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Marry, sir, they have committed false

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: report; moreover, they have spoken untruths;

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: secondarily, they are slanders; sixth and lastly, they

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: have belied a lady; thirdly, they have verified unjust

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: things; and, to conclude, they are lying knaves.

speaker: PRINCE
text: First, I ask thee what they have done; thirdly, I

speaker: PRINCE
text: ask thee what’s their offense; sixth and lastly, why

speaker: PRINCE
text: they are committed; and, to conclude, what you lay

speaker: PRINCE
text: to their charge.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Rightly reasoned, and in his own division;

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: and, by my troth, there’s one meaning well suited.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Who have you offended,

speaker: PRINCE
text: masters, that you are thus bound to your

speaker: PRINCE
text: answer? This learned constable is too cunning to be

speaker: PRINCE
text: understood. What’s your offense?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Sweet prince, let me go no farther to mine

speaker: BORACHIO
text: answer. Do you hear me, and let this count kill me.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: I have deceived even your very eyes. What your

speaker: BORACHIO
text: wisdoms could not discover, these shallow fools

speaker: BORACHIO
text: have brought to light, who in the night overheard

speaker: BORACHIO
text: me confessing to this man how Don John your

speaker: BORACHIO
text: brother incensed me to slander the Lady Hero, how

speaker: BORACHIO
text: you were brought into the orchard and saw me

speaker: BORACHIO
text: court Margaret in Hero’s garments, how you disgraced

speaker: BORACHIO
text: her when you should marry her. My villainy

speaker: BORACHIO
text: they have upon record, which I had rather seal with

speaker: BORACHIO
text: my death than repeat over to my shame. The lady is

speaker: BORACHIO
text: dead upon mine and my master’s false accusation.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: And, briefly, I desire nothing but the reward of a

speaker: BORACHIO
text: villain.
